titleStmt.title: An agreement of the free people of England. Tendered as a peace-offering to this distressed nation. By Lieutenant Colonel Iohn Lilburne, Master William Walwyn, Master Thomas Prince, and Master Richard Overton, prisoners in the Tower of London, May the 1. 1649
titleStmt.author: Overton, Richard, fl. 1646, attributed name.
Lilburne, John, 1614?-1657.

titleStmt.title: An agreement of the free people of England. Tendered as a peace-offering to this distressed nation. By Lieutenant Colonel Iohn Lilburne, Master William Walwyn, Master Thomas Prince, and Master Richard Overton, prisoners in the Tower of London, May the 1. 1649

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Gyles Calvert at the black spread-Eagle at the VVest end of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: Incorporates portions of "Foundations of freedom" by John Lilburne or Richard Overton.
Printer's name and place of publication from colophon; date from Thomason annotation.
Reproductions of the originals in the British Library.
